Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the Trump administration in the construction of the Pennsylvania chemical plant and Louisiana liquefied natural gas plant.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the projects were already in the works during the Obama years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the projects "could never have happened" without the Trump administration.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Trump administration was solely responsible for the construction of the plants, without considering other contributing factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the projects were initiated and approved before Trump took office, suggesting that his administration may not have been the sole driving force behind them.
